creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: diptych; a (left): seated man with the bottom of his face hidden by his sleeve, wearing a kimono with gold and orange birds and tan and green could on a black background, and grey geometric patterns on white ground, and yellow socks; man holds a yellow fan with a red spot above his head; two swords in foreground; b (right): woman in profile from PL with head turned toward front, wearing a blue kimono with arching orange and green elements with blue circles and red hem, and underkimono of blue with white geometric lines; stylized pairs of black bird silhouettes at top; bold text at top and outer edges at center of each sheet; one character with round text cartouche at left edge in LLQ on a and at LLC on b
dimension: 13 3/4 × 9 13/16 in. (34.93 × 24.92 cm) (image, sheet, vertical ōban, each)
markings: each sheet, censor seal: 極 {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: 大 {Dai}
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: on each sheet:  五渡亭國貞画 {Gototei Kunisada ga}
text: Presumably related to the play Ichinotani futaba gunki 一谷嫩軍記, performed at the Nakamura Theater, 1833, 7th month.
title: Actors Yamashita Kinsaku IV as Kumagai's wife Sagami (R) and Nakamura Shikan II as Kumagai Jirō Naozane (L)
